title.narrative: Upper Secondary Education Sector Development Program

description.narrative: The program is the response of the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to the government's vision of improving the quality of its human resources to sustain Cambodia's economic development and enhance its competitiveness. This will be achieved by supporting sequenced reforms aimed at improving the effectiveness of upper secondary education (USE). The program will (i) support initiatives to improve access to, quality of, and relevance of USE; and (ii) strengthen institutional capacity for planning, management, and delivery of education. While the policy reforms will be applied nationwide, most of the project activities will be implemented in seven disadvantaged provinces.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Effectiveness of the USE system improved

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
GER for USE increased to 30% (female: 30%); (SY2015/16 baseline: 25.1%, female: 26.0%)

description.narrative: Effectiveness of the USE system improved

title.narrative: Promotion rate from grade 10 to 11 increased to at least 90% (female: 90%) (SY2014/15 baseline: 82.2%, female: 83.2%)

description.narrative: Effectiveness of the USE system improved
